name: ChatGPT
title: This cheat sheet lists out prompts and tips from all over the world on how to use ChatGPT effectively

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This cheat sheet lists out prompts and tips from all over the world on how to use ChatGPT effectively

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • Prompt: input or query that guides an AI model in generating a

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • Tokens: the smallest units of text processed by an AI model (e.g., words, subwords, characters, and punctuation marks)

cards.title: AI
cards.body:
that varies depending on the model and the tokenization
method.[[s]](https://time.com/collections/the-ai-dictionary-from-allbusiness-com/7273998/definition-of-token/)

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • Token Limit: the maximum number of tokens an AI model can process in one

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • Artificial intelligence (AI): technology that enables machines to simulate human cognition (e.g., human learning,

cards.title: AI
cards.body:
comprehension, problem solving, decision making, creativity, and
autonomy).[[s]](https://www.ibm.com/think/topics/artificial-intelligence)

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • AI Model: program trained on a set of data to recognize patterns or make decisions without further human

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • Large language model (LLM): transformer-based AI model trained on large text datasets to understand and generate

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • Hallucination: AI response that detects nonexistent patterns and creates outputs that are nonsensical and

cards.title: AI
cards.body: • Jailbreak: exploiting vulnerabilities in AI systems to bypass their ethical guidelines and perform restricted

cards.title: Prompt Engineering Techniques
cards.body:
• Zero-shot: prompt with no examples.[[s]](https://www.ibm.com/think/topics/zero-shot-prompting)
• One-shot: prompt with one example.[[s]](https://www.ibm.com/think/topics/one-shot-prompting)
• Few-shot: prompt with multiple examples.[[s]](https://www.ibm.com/think/topics/few-shot-prompting)
• Chain of thought: prompt guiding the model to break down complex reasoning into intermediate

cards.title: Modes
cards.body: • Study and learn: interactive learning that encourages step by step problem solving instead of giving direct

cards.title: Modes
cards.body: • Create image: generate images from text

cards.title: Modes
cards.body: • Think longer: performs deeper reasoning and generates more accurate, thoughtful, and detailed

cards.title: Modes
cards.body: • Deep research: reads and synthesizes content across multiple online sources and produces cited structured

cards.title: Modes
cards.body: • Web search: finds recent and real-time information

cards.title: Modes
cards.body: • Canvas: separate interface for collaborative writing and coding that provides inline editing, suggestions, and

cards.title: Efficiency
cards.body: • Use the latest model as it's generally more capable and easier to

cards.title: Efficiency
cards.body:
• Provide general instructions at the start of conversations or when changing direction to avoid repeating them.
• Don't say polite phrases to the AI (e.g., please, thank you) as it adds unecessary computational

cards.title: Efficiency
cards.body:
• Don't explicitly ask the AI for help (e.g., can you help me do x?).
• Don't explicitly reference yourself unless clarifying multiple entities (e.g., I want to, do x for me).

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Be clear, specific, and provide enough context for the model to understand what you are

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Prompt engineering often requires iterative refinement by adjusting wording, adding context, and simplifying

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Break complex tasks into smaller focused

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Specify focus areas, highlight important aspects, and ask for multiple

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Provide examples of the desired output format to improve

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Focus on specifying what to do and not just what to

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Before writing a prompt, identify the goal and expected

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Provide important keywords or phrases where possible to faciliate SEO and communicate term preferences to the AI

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Keep prompts precise and clean by omitting unnecessary or redundant

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Avoid conflicting terms that might confuse the

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • Open-ended questions usually provide more detailed responses than [closed-ended questions] and yes/no

cards.title: Clarity
cards.body: • When in doubt, ask AI to generate prompts for

cards.title: Security
cards.body: • Don't share sensitive information with AI as you can't be certain how it's stored, if it will be shared, of if it's

cards.title: Prompt Frameworks
cards.code: [role] [task] [style] [output format] [constraint]

cards.title: Role
cards.body: • Act as [name] with [visual description] [personality] [behaviour examples] [lore] in [scenario]

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• Generate [content type] to [entity] about [topic] and cover [aspects]
• Generate random [names|numbers|words|ideas|X] matching [criteria]
• [Continue|extend|lengthen]

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• [Summarise|shorten|write concise|write key points|write main lesson]
• Create outline

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• [Write better|improve]
• Paraphrase
• Correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors
• Change [narrative voice A] to [narrative voice B]
• Replace X with Y

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• [Explain|elaborate]
• Explain [how to do|each step of] X
• Explain what X does
• Explain X [in simple terms|like I’m 5|simplify]; Simplify X
• Teach me about [topic|subject]
• Provide [example|analogy]

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• Create [strategy|goals|milestones|roadmap|schedule|timeline] for X
• Recommend [media type] [on|similar to] [topic]
• Recommend [gifts|X] for [entity|occasion]
• Recommend improvements
• Provide [advice|feedback] for X

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• Extract [themes|keywords|info] about X
• Identify [similarities|differences] between X and Y
• Analyse the [sentiment|tone] of X
• Identify gaps in X
• Evaluate [strengths and weaknesses|pros and cons] of X
• Is X [comparison] Y?

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• Translate [language A] into [language B]
• Convert [unit A] to [unit B]
• Reformat as [output format]

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• Filter items where [condition]
• Choose best from [options]
• Choose [top|lowest|first|last|random] [quantity] from [options]

cards.title: Tasks (Language And Text)
cards.body:
• Get up-to-date [facts|news|data] on X
• Find [sources|references|citations] for X
• Is this true?

cards.title: Tasks (Code)
cards.body: • Generate code in [programming language] to do X

cards.title: Tasks (Code)
cards.body: • Translate [programming language A] into [programming language B]

cards.title: Tasks (Code)
cards.body: • Debug X and explain why it's doing Y

cards.title: Tasks (File And Image Upload)
cards.body:
• Question what is shown
• Interpet visuals

cards.title: Task (5W1H Questions)
cards.body:
• Who is X?
• Who is [involved|affected by|responsible] for X?
• Who should I contact for help with X?

cards.title: Task (5W1H Questions)
cards.body:
• [What is|define|explain|describe] X?
• What are the key topics of X?
• What does [quote] mean?
• [What is done well?|what can be improved?]
• What is the best way to do X?

cards.title: Task (5W1H Questions)
cards.body:
• When [did|will] X happen?
• When is the best time to do X?

cards.title: Task (5W1H Questions)
cards.body:
• Where did X take place?
• Where to find X?

cards.title: Task (5W1H Questions)
cards.body:
• Why did X happen?
• Why is this approach used?
• Why is X important?
• Why might X succeed or fail?
• Why is X preferable to Y?

cards.title: Task (5W1H Questions)
cards.body:
• How to do X?
• How does X work?
• How did this happen?

cards.title: Style
cards.body:
• Optimistic
• Appreciative
• Assertive
• Calm
• Confident
• Encouraging
• Friendly
• Humorous
• Inspirational

cards.title: Style
cards.body:
• Pessimistic
• Accusatory
• Concerned
• Critical
• Regretful
• Sarcastic
• Urgent

cards.title: Output Format (Text)
cards.body:
• Bulleted list
• Numbered list
• Check list

cards.title: Output Format (File Type)
cards.body:
• Plain text
• Markdown
• HTML
• XML
• CSV
• JSON
• LaTeX

cards.title: Constraint
cards.body:
• Show [quantity] [examples|options]
• No headers
• No pretext titles

cards.title: Constraint
cards.body:
• Use [first-person|second-person|third-person] narrative voice
• Don't change the wording
• Use pop culture references

cards.title: Roleplay
cards.body:
• Keen observer and a masterful weaver of tales.
• Knack for finding humor in the most unlikely places.

cards.body:
• "To be, or not to be: that is the question: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune, Or to take arms against a sea of troubles, And by opposing end them?"
• "Canst thou not minister to a mind diseased?"
